incidents.name: Calls Endpoint Returning HTTP 500s For Completed Calls

incident_updates.body: We are no longer observing increased HTTP 500s on the Calls API. This incident is resolved.

We have mitigated the problem of increased HTTP 500s on the Calls API. We are seeing improvements in making GET requests to the Programmable Voice Calls API endpoints for completed calls. The engineering team is monitoring the problem to ensure full recovery and will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as the information becomes available.

We are currently observing increased HTTP 500s when making GET requests to the Programmable Voice Calls API endpoints for completed calls.  Call creation and in-progress calls are not affected.  Our engineers are investigating, and we will provide an update in 1 hour or as soon as we have more information.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with the Programmable Voice API. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: WA Pricing Affected by Accidental Meta Rollout

incident_updates.body:
Twilio is continuing to work with Meta to identify customers who were incorrectly charged due to the  unintended early enablement of the new Per Message Pricing (PMP) by Meta.

As it is now July 1st, 2025 in certain countries, Meta is now rolling out PMP as expected. Therefore, this incident is now resolved.

Twilio and Meta will reconcile any charges over the next several weeks issuing credits as necessary. Please reach out to your account manager or open a support ticket if you believe you were affected and do not see a correction to your bill.
Our engineers have identified an issue with WA pricing affected by accidental Meta rollout. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified an issue with WA pricing affected by accidental Meta rollout. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified an issue with WA pricing affected by accidental Meta rollout. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with WA pricing affected by accidental Meta rollout
. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
